meanings.definition: A product that is produced in insufficient quantities.
meanings.sent1: The store ran out of underproductions quickly.
meanings.sent2: The underproductions on the shelves were sold out within hours.
meanings.sent3: The party had so many guests, but the underproductions of snacks left everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was like underproductions in a sea of abundance, drawing attention for its scarcity.
meanings.sent5: The underproductions of rare stamps were highly sought after by collectors.

meanings.definition: The act or process of producing something in insufficient quantities.
meanings.sent1: The underproductions of the factory led to delays in delivery.
meanings.sent2: The underproductions of the bakery resulted in disappointed customers.
meanings.sent3: The underproductions of jokes at the party made everyone laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: Her singing was like underproductions in a concert hall filled with talent.
meanings.sent5: The underproductions of the play left the audience wanting more.
